subject: Leadership
title: Building an Ethical Culture
description: A quick, practical guide to Building an Ethical Culture.

hook.text: Rules don't create ethical organizations. Culture does. And culture starts at the top every single day.

buildup.text: Trevino's ethical culture model: formal systems like codes and training matter less than what leaders actually reward.

discovery.text: When unethical behavior is rewarded with promotions and ethical behavior is ignored, people get the real message fast.

twist.text: Most companies have ethics codes. Few live by them. The code on the wall matters less than the behavior in the hall.

climax.text: Reward ethical behavior visibly. Punish violations consistently regardless of rank. Walk the talk every day.

punchline.text: Culture isn't what you preach. It's what you tolerate.

quiz.question: What shapes ethical culture more than formal codes?
options: What leaders actually reward and tolerate
